projects.name: Haiku Finder
projects.description: A small website that uses the Syllable API to generate a haiku from user input. JavaScript is used to split the inputted text into sentences, which then filters into sentences with five and seven syllables. A random index is chosen from these two arrays to display a haiku to the use. Created to learn how to use APIs in web development.

projects.name: 3D Traffic Simulator
projects.description: A 3D-rendered simulation of traffic light control system that I helped co-develop. The team-developed project includes documentation about how the traffic light controller works and the requirements needed to create the simulation. Learned more about working under a waterfall software development model and how to use JavaFX to create a 3D simulation.

projects.name: Breakout Competitive - Java Networking Project
projects.description: A team developed game of 4-player breakout using a UDP connection. Developed with Ethan Puzak and Araceli Casas.

projects.name: Endless Centipede - Live Game Practice
projects.description: A clone of the classic game Centipede using JavaFX. Learned about live animations and efficient collision detection.

projects.name: Hexapawn - Reinforced Learning
projects.description: A checkers-like game made with JavaFX. A reinforcement learning algorithm is used to train the AI to play the game.

projects.name: Multiplication Circle - JavaFX Animation
projects.description: A visualization of the multiplication table using JavaFX. The program renders dots in a fixed-radius circle and uses an multiplication to connect two dots with a line. Learned about creating animations and how to use JavaFX.
